page.title: 09Monroe Devis Maternity Home
page.content: Health.The Monroe Devis is a maternity home run by the Health Authority.It has 3 wards and 3 delivery rooms and can cater for up to 20 babies at one time.There are 24 nurses who are mostly part time, as well as domestic, cleaning,and gardening staff.The babies can stay with their mothers at all times and are fed on demand.The Home still uses terry towelling nappies and Infa-care when the babies are bathed.The babies who are not breast-fed have prepared cows' milk and sugared boiled water.The Home is due to close late in 1985.There has been a strong protest movement but to no avail.The patients will be moved to the Warneford Hospital in Leamington where 4 extra beds will be provided to make a total of 52.The Warneford has an anaesthetist and a paediatrician, but will it be as pleasant?
